channel.title: Tableau on Portfolio - Blanka Móri
channel.description: Recent content in Tableau on Portfolio - Blanka Móri

item.title: Category KPI donuts in Tableau
item.description: I have a logistics data set and I wanted to create donut charts in Tableau about the status of the order. There are 3 categories: completed, canceled and pending. The goal of the viz is to show the percentage of this category compared to the total. 1. Create a two-slice pie chart For this we need the number of orders in a certain order status, and the number of orders belonging to all the other statuses.

item.title: Mapping: Bridging Old Municipality Borders to Modern Territories
item.description: I want to see on a map how people voted in 1956 in the Netherlands. But how can I dot that if the geographical units have changed since then? Tableau does not have historical map capabilities. So, the only solution is connecting the old municipalities to the current territories. Back then there were 1008 of them, and now just 342. Note that I excluded Flevoland, the artificially created province from the analysis.
